alert.note: Alert for Northumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 2:07PM EDT until June 26 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Columbia, Northumberland and Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 207 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Shamokin, Mount Carmel, Kulpmont, Ashland, Elysburg, Girardville, Marshallton, Lavelle, Aristes, Fountain Springs, Numidia, Wilburton Number One, Locustdale, Wilburton Number Two, Knoebels Grove, Gordon, Marion Heights and Centralia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
